author: Trista Kelley
title: Five Things: Anthem Cigna China PMI Amazon Troika
text:
Amazon posts a huge report, a shock tumble in China manufacturing and creditors head to Greece. Here are some of the things that people in markets are talking about this morning.
Amazon delivers profit. Stock surges Amazon reported a surprise second-quarter profit on top of sales that beat estimates, showing investors -- as it has done before -- that the Web retailer can make money when it puts the brakes on investments. The stock soared 17 percent in early trading -- a gain that would put Amazon's market cap above that of the world's largest retailer, Wal-Mart.
China PMI slump jolts markets Chinese manufacturing unexpectedly fell to the lowest level in 15 months , putting pressure on authorities to do more to meet China's 2015 growth target of about 7 percent. The preliminary Purchasing Managersâ€™ Index from Caixin Media and Markit Economics was at 48.2 for July, worse than all 16 forecasts in a Bloomberg survey. The data pushed emerging-market stocks lower, sent metals sliding and drove the Australian dollar to a six-year low. Manufacturing data out of Germany also came in on the weak side.
The troika heads to Athens Greece's three main official creditors, dubbed the troika, are sending representatives back to Athens today to kick off negotiations for a third bailout. After tapping a 7 billion-euro bridge loan to avoid defaulting on the European Central Bank this month, Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras is racing to complete negotiations before about 3.2 billion euros more comes due to the ECB on Aug. 20. Meanwhile, the Athens Stock Exchange is due to reopen early next week.
Anthem to buy Cigna Another healthcare mega deal. After nearly a year of negotiations, Health insurer Anthem has agreed to buy Cigna for more than $48 billion . Anthem CEO Joseph Swedish will run the combined company. Cigna's CEO David Cordani will be President and COO.
U.S. data due U.S. manufacturing is expected to hold in July at 53.6 -- a level indicating expansion -- while new home sales are expected to rise at a faster annualized pace in June. Economists see the odds of a Fed rate increase in September at 50/50, exactly where they were last month. On the earnings front: Biogen, Xerox and American Airlines are due to report today.
